title: Labour ditching Corbyn is the worst thing that could happen for Boris
text:
You hardly need me to point out the change in the political weather over the past few weeks. When Boris Johnson became PM in July, the Tories seemed bereft of any purpose. Now, despite the parliamentary shenanigans over Brexit (perhaps, in part, because of them) the Conservatives have consistent double digit poll leads.

They are pursuing an election strategy focused on life beyond Brexit, with multiple announcements on crime and public services and ministers roaming the country to finding hospitals in which to pose for pictures.

On Brexit itself, there is a clear narrative of a government doing everything in its power to deliver our departure from the EU, frustrated by a Labour Party that scuppers...
description: You hardly need me to point out the change in the political weather over the past few weeks.
